intro: Cockaynea laevis, commonly known as the silky cockaynea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features soft, silvery-green foliage with a velvety texture, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Cockaynea laevis is often found in grasslands and open areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
